page.title: 17An Unusual Day
page.content: Today I woke up early at 6 o'clock. I was very excited because today I was going with my class and my teacher Mrs Elliott and my Headmaster Mr Barratt to the East of England Show at Peterborough. We were going because we had been working on a project for the last two terms called Sheep and the Uses of Wool. The result of all of our work was put together as a display and this was being shown in the Schools Tent at the Show. It was a jolly good display and my pottery model of a sheep and my wool dieing were there. After we had been given a prize for our work, we went around the show. We saw lots of farm machinery and sheep, horses and cows and then we went to the main ring where we saw sheep dogs rounding up sheep and sailors climbing a mast and horses pulling carts.
